Observation Log 01

OBSERVATION METADATA
Log ID: DSL-01-2003-06-28
Location: Deep Trench B-13, Observation Window 4
Depth: 487 meters
Observer: Dr. H. Yamamoto
Timestamp: 2003/06/28 03:47 JST
Classification: ROUTINE / UNDER REVIEW

Observation Notes

During routine early-morning monitoring of Deep Trench sector B-13, observation window 4 captured unusual bioluminescent patterns at depth level 487m. The pattern exhibited rhythmic pulsation inconsistent with known deep-sea species in our catalog.

Initial analysis suggests possible undocumented cephalopod behavior, though pressure readings during the observation period showed minor anomalies (±0.3 bar fluctuation). Video feed timestamp experienced brief desynchronization lasting approximately 4.2 seconds.

Specimen collection attempted but unsuccessful. Observation window has been flagged for recalibration. Further monitoring scheduled.

Technical Details

  • Image Quality: 78% (minor corruption in lower-left quadrant)
  • Camera: Subsurface Unit SSU-08
  • Light Source: Infrared + UV composite
  • Exposure Time: 0.8 seconds
  • Post-Processing: Minimal color correction applied

Follow-Up Actions

  • [ ] Recalibrate observation window sensors
  • [ ] Cross-reference with historical bioluminescence database
  • [ ] Schedule follow-up observation during same time window
  • [x] Image archived in research database
Access Notice
This log is publicly accessible for educational purposes. Full technical data available to L3+ personnel only. Report any discrepancies to facility management.
